title: Snipe Conley
text: James Patrick "Snipe" Conley (April 25, 1892 – January 7, 1978) was a <a href="professional%20baseball">professional baseball</a> <a href="pitcher">pitcher</a>. He played all or part of three seasons in <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a>, for the <a href="Baltimore%20Terrapins">Baltimore Terrapins</a> of the <a href="Federal%20League">Federal League</a> in 1914 and 1915, and for the <a href="Cincinnati%20Reds">Cincinnati Reds</a> in 1918. He continued to play in the <a href="minor%20league%20baseball">minors</a> until 1926, then came back at age 47 to pitch in two games for the minor league <a href="Dallas%20Rebels">Dallas Rebels</a> in 1941.
